9.3 Cellulitis  
Type of Infection 
First Line (with 
Dosage and

Alternative (with 
dosage and

Comments 
Cellulitis – non purulent  
Prefer β-lactams. 
Penicillin V 250-500 
q6h 
Or 
Amoxicillin 500mg 
TDS (25-50 
mg/kg/day)  
Or 
Cloxacillin 500mg 
QID (50mg/kg/day)  
Or 
Cephalexin 250-
500mg QID (25–50 
mg/kg/day) 
Or 
Cefadroxil 500 mg 
q12h 
Clindamycin: 300-
600mg BD/TID 
(20mg/kg/day) 
 
 
Duration of therapy is 5 to 
7 days based on clinical 
response. 
 
 
Cellulitis- moderate to 
severe 
Inj Cefazolin 1-2g q8h  
Or  
Inj Amoxicillin-
clavulanate 1.2g TDS 
 
Severe infection: 
Inj Cefuroxime 
1.5g q8h  
Or 
Inj Clindamycin 
600-900mg IV TDS 
(if allergic to 
penicillins) 
 
Duration of therapy is 7 to 
10 days based on clinical 
response. 
Cellulitis with MRSA risk 
factors: 
Mild 
 
 
Moderate to Severe 
 
Trimethoprim-
sulfamethoxazole 
800 mg/160 mg BD 
 
 
Vancomycin 15 to 20 
mg/kg/dose every 8 
to 12 hours. 
Doxycycline 100 
mg q12h 
 
 
 
Inj Linezolid 
600mg q12 h 
 
Duration of therapy is 5 to 
10 days based on severity. 
A longer duration of 
antibiotic treatment may be 
a consideration in patients 
who show minimal 
improvement with 
antibiotic therapy within 48 
hours. 
Cellulitis in patients with 
comorbidities, poor 
response to oral antibiotics, 
immunocompromised, 
signs of deeper infection 
Inj Piperacillin-
tazobactam 4.5g q6h  
±  
As per culture 
susceptibility 
reports 
 
Duration of therapy is 7 to 
10 days based on severity.
